content.description: A right trending route full of side clings, a fingerlock, and loads of lichen up top. Stay left of the line and expect small delicate footholds that are less than you want.
content.location: Far right end of the wall on a sloping ledge.

content.description: From route author: Easy though awkward climbing through blocky features leads to a pull over the small roof and an exciting cruxy slab finish.
The route developers have moved on and route descriptions/details are slim. You'll have to go out and explore.Leftmost route in the sport cave. Take a long or extendable draw for the last placement.
content.protection: Fixed Anchors***Some climbers have reported fixed draws that are aging and should not be used.
content.location: Rock along Sandy Hook Rd, near the main Maryland Heights cliffs.

content.description: Once you make it to the  base of The Transept (either by climbing directly or scrambling around), build a gear anchor for the belayer. The route is a short, overhanging crack that leads up  through a roof and a tough mantle. Keep a #2 C4 at the ready for a funky placement just over the roof. Alternatively, you can bail right for an easier but more run-out finish.
content.protection: Bring gear to 3 inches and you'll be set for everything including the belayers anchor.
content.location:
The best bet would be to scope it out from the canal trail and scramble up the hillside.  

  At the top of the route, you'll have to build a gear anchor.  The walk off is easy, it looks like a tower from the road, but it's attached at the back.

climbs.name: The Boy Who Wouldn't Grow Up

content.description: Climbing at the cave. Starts with 2 bolts in a crack/chimney feature and exits roof left onto the obvious face.

content.location: Unsure of route locations. Needs updated info.

content.description: This area is fairly spread out, and will get sun from sunrise until the late afternoon.  With the black rock and its orientation, it makes for a prime late fall and early spring area.
